Articles.Content:
hello

so i built a rover, with 1 command capsule, square plate and 4 wheels.

now i managed to land it on Minimus yet it looks like my capsule keeps acting like its a ship, rotating around itself when press A or D instead of turning...

W rotates it forward instead of "driving" it forward...

what did I do wrong?
Rebind wheel controls, to IJKL for example. You can activate ASAS to prevent turning in low gravity even further.

Use the docking mode, that'll turn off the torque.

Are your brakes on? Do you have electricity?
Also what wheel you're using? some wheels exert more torque than others.
IJKL keys wont respond... yet when i clock A or D it looks like the wheels are turning, yet they do so with the capsule rotating to the side (gyro-thing is active)

IJKL keys wont respond... yet when i clock A or D it looks like the wheels are turning, yet they do so with the capsule rotating to the side (gyro-thing is active)

You have to manually rebind wheel keyboard controls in options menu, by default it is WSAD.
Do you have rcs on or off?
Rather than rebinding the keys, just click "docking" in the lower left corner of the screen.
